title: RFO Readiness Program Manager (12 months contract)
summary: Every day, people do amazing things at Apple. Join us and you’ll do the best work of your life and make a difference in other people’s lives. The Pacific Retail Fulfilment Operations (PAC RFO) Digital team is responsible for ensuring an outstanding customer experience through planning and executing end-to-end supply chain fulfilment processes for Apple Online. An opportunity exists for a self-motivated individual to join as RFO Readiness Program Manager.
description:
-  Own and drive Apple Online and Store launch plans, including end-to-end planning, system setups, execution, reporting and post-mortem, for NPI and direct promotions
-  Own launch status updates and executive reporting to Regional and Worldwide senior management teams for assigned line of business and promotions
-  Collaborate closely with Worldwide and Regional cross-functional teams to influence, align and support launch strategy and Plan of Records, to ensure successful implement of launch requirements
-  Be the key point of contact to RFO management and Pacific Operations (Pac Ops) leadership during launch/promotion health reviews and drive risk mitigation under tight timelines
-  Review past launches and promotions to identify key wins and opportunities for process improvements
-  Document and implement new processes effectively through change management and cross-functional collaboration
-  Lead or participate in cross-functional initiatives including business requirements definition, User Acceptance Testing (UAT) as required in order to implement new, improved systems/processes capabilities that have impact to peak event planning/execution
key_qualifications:
-  Minimum 6-9 years of experience in program, project management and/or business analytics with proven track record of successful implementation of mid to large-scale projects
-  Excellent interpersonal and stakeholder management skills in a fast-paced matrix organization
-  Critical thinker with a strong sense of urgency to resolve issues
-  Agile in ambiguity, with an ability to persevere and adapt under pressure
-  Meticulous with great attention to detail
-  Good analytical skills, with ability to translate complex findings and analysis to a business audience and executive level
-  Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to tailor presentation style to different levels of an organization
-  Strategic problem solver with demonstrated ability to make and implement process improvement recommendations
-  Experience and knowledge of multiple disciplines within supply chain operations and product management is a plus
education_experience: Degree in fields such as Operations, Business Management, Supply Chain Management, or Finance required. Masters or advanced degree is a plus.
